botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Contact may irritate the skin. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Vitis are vigorous deciduous climbing shrubs with tendrils and attractively lobed leaves, insignificant green flowers followed by often edible fruits; some have excellent autumn foliage colour

how_to_grow.cultivation: Vigorous decorative vine with unpalatable fruits, best in a sunny position in well-drained, preferably neutral or alkaline soil
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by layering or hardwood cuttings
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 11 in midwinter and in midsummer, pruning group 12 for formal training
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to grapevine blister mite, glasshouse red spider mite, brown scale, woolly vine scale and spotted wing drosophila (fruit fly)
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to Powdery mildews, grey moulds, honey fungus and virus diseases. For further advice see grapevine diseases
